qas.question: What party carried the position of D.C. Statehood?
What party did the D.C. Statehood Party merge when?
When did the movement get closest to success?
What would be the new name of the D.C. State?
When did the drive for statehood falter?
What party carried the position of Columbia statehood?
What party did the Washington Party merge with?
When did Columbia get closest to success?
What would be the new name of the Columbia state?
When did the drive for Columbian statehood falter?

context: This position was carried by the <a0_0><b5_0>D.C. Statehood Party<b5_0/><a0_0/>, a political party; it has since merged with <a1_0><b6_0>the local Green Party affiliate<b6_0/><a1_0/> to form the D.C. Statehood Green Party. The nearest this movement ever came to success was in <a2_0><b7_0>1978<b7_0/><a2_0/>, when Congress passed the District of Columbia Voting Rights Amendment. Two years later in 1980, local citizens passed an initiative calling for a constitutional convention for a new state. In 1982, voters ratified the constitution of the state, which was to be called <a3_0><b8_0>New Columbia<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The drive for statehood stalled in <a4_0><b9_0>1985<b9_0/><a4_0/>, however, when the Washington, D.C. Voting Rights Amendment failed because not enough states ratified the amendment within the seven-year span specified.
